\chapter{CryptX}
\hypertarget{md__2_users_2acagliano_2_repositories_2toolchain_2src_2cryptx_2_r_e_a_d_m_e}{}\label{md__2_users_2acagliano_2_repositories_2toolchain_2src_2cryptx_2_r_e_a_d_m_e}\index{CryptX@{CryptX}}
\label{md__2_users_2acagliano_2_repositories_2toolchain_2src_2cryptx_2_r_e_a_d_m_e_autotoc_md0}%
\Hypertarget{md__2_users_2acagliano_2_repositories_2toolchain_2src_2cryptx_2_r_e_a_d_m_e_autotoc_md0}%
 CryptX provides industry-\/standard cryptography for the TI-\/84+ CE graphing calculator. The package contains three(3) separate libraries that serve different functions.\hypertarget{md__2_users_2acagliano_2_repositories_2toolchain_2src_2cryptx_2_r_e_a_d_m_e_autotoc_md1}{}\doxysection{\texorpdfstring{Getting Started with CryptX}{Getting Started with CryptX}}\label{md__2_users_2acagliano_2_repositories_2toolchain_2src_2cryptx_2_r_e_a_d_m_e_autotoc_md1}
Visit the \href{https://acagliano.github.io/cryptx}{\texttt{ CryptX Documentation}} for help with using the library, documentation, cryptanalysis, credits, and more.

Credits\+: ~\newline
 Some algorithms sourced at least in part from \href{https://github.com/B-Con/crypto-algorithms}{\texttt{ B-\/con crypto-\/algorithms}}. ~\newline
 Cemetech user Zeroko -\/ information on CE randomness. ~\newline
 beckadamtheinventor \& commandblockguy -\/ coding assistance, conversion of some C routines to assembly for speed. ~\newline
 jacobly -\/ modular exponentiation
